title: Biden Picks Wall Street Critic Saule Omarova to Oversee Large Banks
sub_head: Comptroller of the Currency nominee faces difficult path to Senate confirmation
body:
WASHINGTONâ€”The Biden administration formally nominated Saule Omarova, a law professor and critic of big banks, to serve as a top banking regulator, a setback for Wall Street and other firms that had pushed to scuttle her nomination.
The move Tuesday comes about a month after the administration said it intended to nominate the Cornell University law professor to serve as the Comptroller of the Currency, a powerful regulator charged with overseeing large national banks.
